lines.text: I coulda been a chief.
Oh yeah? How come you're not a chief now?
Eh, I got no stomach for politics.
Ain't that 'Trebler'? I said ain't that Lee's horse?
Yes.
[as he attends to wounded Lt. Driscoll that O'Meara brought in]
What's Lee doing here?
He's surrendering to Grant.
[he continues tending to Driscoll's wound]
Lead looks mighty close to the heart.
That's the first Yankee I missed in four years. Bet you because the bullets warped.

[Annoyed]
Well why didn't you cut it out and looked for yourself?
Because I didn't want to dirty me hands , that's why!
Then why you bring him in here? Why didn't you just leave 'em out there to bleed to death?
There's Gen. Lee! He still got's his sword!
Grant must have let him keep it.
Maybe he didn't want to give it up!
We lost the war soldier. Lee has struck his last tin.

[Gen.Grant comes out to see Gen. Lee off]
So there he is, the great and glorious Gen. Grant.

[as O'Meara raises his rifle to shoot Gen. Grant in the back]
If you're gonna shoot Grant, you better shoot Lee too. Else the shame will kill him.

[the surgeon hands O'Meara the bullet he just took out of Driscoll]
It's just like I said. Like I said from the beginning, the bullets warped, warped.
It's the last bullet shot in this war.
Well, he went and done it. Gen. Lee got right down on his hands and knees and begged President Johnson for pardon. If it's good enough for my brethren, then I reckon it's good enough for me.
He never begged.
He never begged? I wish you was right.
What makes you so sure.
Well, when I went back to town to get that bullet, I heard it official. That he swallowed his pride and begged.
What bullet?
Why that bullet you had cut out of that Yankee Lieutenant you shot the last day of the war.
How did you get it?
Your ma give it to us.
Why?
Well... Look at that.
That ain't the bullet, that's a brand new one.
Ah but the head. It's been fix to shoot again. And there's writing on it.
Writing? What kind of writing?
Well, it says ah... Private O'Meara 6th Virginian Volunteer who shot this last bullet... in War... and missed! Ha-ha!
[long laugh]
It's a little token... a little token from us... to you.
[Hands the bullet to O'Meara]
But the best news... the best news was when your ma said that you come home... in one piece.
The best news I got was when Lincoln was dead. What's the matter mama?
A man shows respect even if it's for a dead damn Yankee president!
Have you lost your reason? That baboon was shot too late.
The bullet which killed him converted Trust into the north.
You talk like you sick in the head.
well he said he was going to take us back in the Union didn't he?
Who cares about the Union?
Lots of us do son. I know it seems a darn right shame we have to take a oath of alligence to the United states to become Americans again.
Lee is begging in the mud now that is fine fitting way to take us back in the union, ain't it?
Well, no man is feeding without some hatred.

And I hate mama... I hate... I don't understand ya ma. Pa was killed at Chicamorgan. Jeff had his head cut off at Fredricksburg. Eli... Elia laid with his belly in his hands bleeding to death in the wheat-fields of Gettysburg. mama I know, I'd seen them. I seen them skin and blood and I buried them. I buried them mama! You didn't! What am I suppose to say now to the Yankees?... Welcome home sir... I love you Yankees!... How did ya... how did you expect me to come home?
I expected you to come home a man with honor!
A man with honor? You expected me to come home with honor? What's the matter with you ma? What's the matter with all of ya?
[starts yelling out loud]
They came here and tore our land mama! The chased us when we had no legs! They stuffed their mouths with our food when we were starving to death! Where's your pride? what's happened to all of ya?
[crying]
The same what happened to some of us who had to take a licking and not cry over it! You don't have to fight for the cause no more!
Mama, I don't have to do anything... I don't have to do anything. i am a rebel cause I want to be not cause I have to be!
Wherever you go... there's going to be Yankees and you got to learn to live with them!
Well maybe but not the place I'll be.
What place?
The West! The far west!
You mean where the savages live?
Savages or no at least they have more pride than us!
There's no hiding place for what ails you son. We are all under one flag now!
I wanna tell you something mother... I'll hang... I'll hang before I recognized that flag!
Maybe a broken neck is the best answer for what ails ya!

[Sick with fever, approaches the tribe]
I wish... I wish to speak to your chief Blue Buffalo...

[Rising from the ground where he was squatting]
I'm Blue Buffalo!
I've lived the Run of the Arrow!

[Blue buffalo has a warrior check O'Meara's feet and addresses Crazy Wolf]
Is this the man that out ran you?
Yes.

[Addressing O'Meara]
You are the first to outlive the Run. You will never die by the hand of a Sioux for this. Give him back his horse and everything else that belongs to him. I don't understand. you speak Sioux like Sioux not like a white man.
My teacher was Walking Coyote.
That poor renegade.
[as Blue Buffalo says this ,O'Meara collapses and faints]

[Crazy Wolf checks on him]
He's sick with the fever!

[Addressing the village]
Our law prevents us from killing any man who lives the Run. But we have no law to help him live. The choice is yours. Who among you will help him thru the night?
I will. I will help him thru the night.

[addressing the village]
He wants to become a Sioux. To take Yellow Moccasin as his squaw and to adopt Silent Tongue as their son. But his skin is enemy!
I'm not an American.
But your skin is white!
But my heart is with the Sioux.
Why?
Because I love your people. I've learn from Yellow Moccasin that a man cannot live alone. he must have allegiance to a people... to a nation. In my heart my nation is Sioux.
Would you kill the Americans in battle?

[pauses for a moment]
Yes.
Are there any objections?
[waits for a reply, there is none]
Mix the blood!
Before you mix the blood, I must speak of my faith.
Faith? What do you mean?
I'm a Christian. I will live as a Sioux... I will hunt as a Sioux... I will fight and I will even die as a Sioux. But my God is a Christian God. I can't serve your greater spirit.
We respect a man who respects his faith. This God of yours is He... the giver and creator of all life? Do you look to Him for the cure of disease and illness to make you strong and healthy?
I do. Yes.
How many Gods do you serve? Do you have more than One?
No, no. Just one.
Just one. Americans, are they all Christians?
No, some are and some are other denominations like your religions.
You are a Christian? Will you kill Christians in battle?

[pauses]
Well... my nation... fought... for liberty against the United States... And Christianity is always the brother of liberty in all wars.
We have the same God but a different name... Mix the blood!
